Description: Fragment of Attic red-figured pottery lekanis lid; interior painted black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of female figures: on left, shoulder of female figure, holding a box to right; upper body of second female figure, to left, wearing sakkos, chiton and himation, and bending towards first figure; at far right, part of undetermined decoration with zigzag motif, probably a sakkos or the like, hanging on the wall.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2107)
